Therefore, although much of the caption aligns with the image, the absence of confirming evidence for the central claim (the record attempt) lowers the overall confidence score and ultimately leads to the conclusion that the caption is out of context, despite the strong alignment of many descriptive elements.  The analysis considers both the consistency of the image and caption elements and the verifiability of the central claim about the record attempt. This discrepancy is weighed against the correct depiction of the fountain, its location, and the accompanying fireworks. Because the central claim lacks sufficient supporting evidence, the caption is deemed out of context.   In summary, the high confidence score from the internal check is somewhat offset by the lower confidence of the external check due to a lack of evidence for the Guinness World Record claim.
